il.ac.hit.costmanager.viewmodels

Class CostManagerViewModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • il.ac.hit.costmanager.viewmodels.CostManagerViewModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IViewModel

    public class CostManagerViewModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements IViewModel
    This class mediates between view and model classes (CostManagerView and CostManagerModel) and describes CostManagerViewModel
    Author:
    Ziv Hochman, Anzor Torikashvili.

                        int userId)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to add a new category that the user has entered.
        Specified by:
        addCategory in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        category - Contains the data of the new category we wish to insert into the database.
        userId - The id of the user.

                        int userId)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to add a new currency that the current user has entered.
        Specified by:
        addCurrency in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        currency - The currency the user wants to add.
        userId - id of the current user.

      • addItem

        public void addItem(Item item,
                    int personId,
                    double transaction)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to add an item that the user inserted from the CostManagerView to the database with the help of the CostManagerModel.
        Specified by:
        addItem in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        item - Contains data of the item the user wants to add.
        personId - The id of the user to which we need to refer the item to.
        transaction - The amount we need to subtract from the user's budget.

      • addPerson

        public void addPerson(Person person)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to add a new person into the database.
        Specified by:
        addPerson in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        person - Contains the data of the new user that will be added to the database.

      • checkTransaction

        public void checkTransaction(Person person,
                             Currency itemCurrency,
                             double itemPrice,
                             Item item)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to check if the current user can make the transaction or not.
        Specified by:
        checkTransaction in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        person - Details of the user who wants to create the transaction.
        itemCurrency - Currency of the item.
        itemPrice - Price of the item.
        item - Details of the item.

      • checkUserExistence

        public void checkUserExistence(java.lang.String firstName,
                               java.lang.String password)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to check if the username and password that were entered indeed exist in the database.
        Specified by:
        checkUserExistence in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        firstName - Contains the username of the user that should already exist in the database.
        password - Contains the password of the user that should already exist in the database.

      • deleteItem

        public void deleteItem(int itemId,
                       int personId)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to delete an item the user chose in the CostManagerView and delete it from the database using the CostManagerModel.
        Specified by:
        deleteItem in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        itemId - Contains the id of the item the user wishes to delete.
        personId - Contains the data of the user's id who wants to delete the item.

      • getDataByDates

        public void getDataByDates(int personId,
                           java.time.LocalDate beginDate,
                           java.time.LocalDate endDate)
        This method mediates between the CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order presents the user the items that are between the two dates that he chose (beginDate and endDate).
        Specified by:
        getDataByDates in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        personId - Contains the ID of the user that we need to present the relevant data to.
        beginDate - The minimum date the items need to have or above.
        endDate - The maximum date the items can have or below it.

      • getItemsForPerson

        public void getItemsForPerson(int personId)
        Mediates between CostManagerView and CostManagerModel in order to present the user the items he has in the database.
        Specified by:
        getItemsForPerson in interface IViewModel
        Parameters:
        personId - Contains the data of the user's ID so that we know which items we need to display and which we don't.
